title: Wells Fargo intro
contenu: The Wells Fargo Mobile app allows credit card users to check and pay their balances, view their “Go Far” cash-back rewards and shop through Wells Fargo’s online portal to earn bonus points. Cardholders can also use the app to manage account alert settings, check their FICO score, dispute a transaction, manage travel plans, replace their card and contact customer service. If you hold other accounts with Wells Fargo — including checking, savings, mortgage, student loan or personal loan accounts — they’ll also be visible on the app when you log in. For Android phones, the app offers the Wells Fargo Wallet feature, a digital wallet that allows you to add your Wells Fargo debit and credit cards. You can use your Wells Fargo Wallet at NFC-enabled point-of-sale systems to pay with your phone instead of the physical card.

title: The Basic Things That You May Know
contenu:
Mobile website, which allows you to access accounts to check account and Rewards balances2, view detailed account activity, make transfers, pay bills, and more.
Text banking, which allows you to quickly request and receive basic account information, and move money between your eligible Wells Fargo accounts via text message.
Apps, which provide the same features as your mobile browser, plus one-touch access to Sign On, easy menu navigation, and GPS-powered ATM/location information.
How much does Wells Fargo Mobile cost?
      There are no fees to use or access wellsfargo.com, text banking, or our apps. Please check with your wireless provider about carrier and web access charges.
CollapseHow is Wells Fargo Mobile secure?
Text banking is secure because:
You view accounts by nicknames you set, not account number
No detailed personal information sent
It’s covered by our Online Security Guarantee
Our mobile website and apps are secure because:
128-bit encryption masks your sensitive information
When you close your browser or the app, the session ends
They’re covered by our Online Security Guarantee
CollapseWhat should I do if I lose my device?
      If your device is lost or stolen, call 1-866-863-6762, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to deactivate your account.
CollapseWhat are mobile preferences and how do I change mine?

title: Text Banking
contenu:
What are the text banking commands?
ACT: View account activity on your primary account. To view account activity of another account, include the account nickname. Example: ACT VISA
BAL: Receive the balance of your primary account. To receive the balance of another account, include the account nickname. Example: BAL SAV
BAL ALL: Receive the balance of all your enrolled accounts
COM: Receive a list of all text banking commands
DUE: View information for your credit card account(s)
TRA: Transfer funds between your Wells Fargo Checking and Savings accounts and to your Wells Fargo Credit card
HELP: Get Wells Fargo contact information
STOP TEXT: Disable text banking
How is text banking secure?
Text banking is secure because:
You view accounts by nicknames you set, not account number
No detailed personal information sent
Text banking won’t send unsolicited text messages
It’s covered by our Online Security Guarantee
Will text banking work on my phone?
      Text banking will work as long as your carrier supports text messaging. Check with your carrier for details about text messaging charges.
Does my mobile carrier support text banking?
Currently, text banking is supported by the following carriers:
AT&T
Alltel
Boost
Cricket Communications
Nextel
Sprint
T-Mobile
US Cellular
Verizon Wireless
Virgin

Are text commands case-sensitive?
      No, commands can be sent in lowercase (bal) or all capital letters (BAL).
Will text banking work on my pre-paid service plan?
At this time, the following pre-paid carriers do not support text banking:
Some Verizon Mobile Virtual Network Operators (MVNOs) (e.g. MIGO)
TRACFONE®

title: Mobile Websites
contenu:
How is the mobile website different from wellsfargo.com?
      The mobile website is optimized to easily make transfers between your accounts and to other customers, pay your bills, find ATMs, and more, from your device.
       For access to all products and services Wells Fargo offer, visit wellsfargo.com via your computer.
Do I need a username and password to access wellsfargo.com?
      Yes, sign on using your Wells Fargo Online® username and password.
How is Wells Fargo Mobile secure?
      Wells Fargo Mobile is secure because:
128-bit encryption masks your sensitive information
When you close your browser or the app the session ends
It’s covered by our Online Security Guarantee
Can I make transfers to another Wells Fargo customer with Wells Fargo Mobile?
      Yes, but before you can make a mobile transfer to another Wells Fargo customer, you must first add the recipient to your transfer list on Wells Fargo Online via your computer.

title: Apps
contenu:
What apps are available?
      Wells Fargo has custom apps for Android devices.
Is there an app for my device?
      Yes, there are apps designed specifically for use for your device. Download the Wells Fargo app from Google Play Store or Amazon App Store for Android smartphones and tablets.
How are Wells Fargo apps secure?
Well Fargo apps are secure because:
128-bit encryption masks your sensitive information
When you close your browser or the app, the session ends
They’re covered by Well Fargo Online Security Guarantee
How do I know I am downloading a legitimate app?
      To ensure the safety of your personal and account information, download apps from reputable sources only. When downloading a Wells Fargo app for your mobile device, ensure that Wells Fargo Bank is listed as the app publisher or seller.
What is Sign On with Android Fingerprint?
      Fingerprint Sign On allows you to use your device’s fingerprint feature to sign on to the Wells Fargo app with your fingerprint instead of entering your username and password.

title: Deposit
contenu:
What is the Wells Fargo Mobile Deposit service?
      With Wells Fargo Mobile Deposit (“Mobile Deposit”) you can make a deposit directly into your eligible checking or savings account using the Wells Fargo Mobile App.

Mobile Deposit lets you submit photos of the front and back of your endorsed check. You can save time with fewer trips to a Wells Fargo ATM or branch.

We use advanced encryption and security technology:
Wells Fargo Online credentials are not stored on your mobile device.
Check images are not stored on your mobile device.
You view accounts by nicknames you can define, not by account numbers.
128-bit encryption masks your sensitive information.
Who’s eligible to use the Mobile Deposit service?
     Wells Fargo Online and Wells Fargo Business Online® customers who are at least 18 years of age, maintain an eligible checking or savings account, and who have accepted the Mobile Deposit Terms and Conditions are eligible to use Mobile Deposit. Enrollment is subject to availability.
How do I get Mobile Deposit?
      Wells Fargo Mobile Deposit (“Mobile Deposit”) is available through the Wells Fargo Mobile app. If you already have Wells forg app, update it with the most recent version.
How does Mobile Deposit work?
It’s secure and easy to use.

Sign on to your Wells Fargo Mobile app then follow these simple steps:
Select the deposit function.
Choose the account where you want to deposit your check.
Enter the check amount.
Take a picture of the front and back of your endorsed check with your mobile device. For photos that work best, follow these guidelines:
Place your check on a dark-colored, plain surface that’s well lit
Position your camera directly over the check (not at an angle)
Fit all 4 corners in the guides of your mobile device’s camera screen
     5.Submit your deposit.
You’ll receive a confirmation message on your mobile device for each successful deposit. Plus, we’ll send a deposit confirmation to your primary email address and your Wells Fargo Online secure mailbox.
What types of checks can I deposit?
    You can deposit checks payable in U.S. dollars and drawn at any U.S. bank, including personal, business, and government checks. They must also be payable to, and endorsed by the account holder.
       International checks, U.S. savings bonds, U.S. postal money orders, remotely created checks (whether in paper form or electronically created), convenience checks (checks drawn against a line of credit), and cash are not eligible for Mobile Deposit.
What are the cut-off times for deposits made with Mobile Deposit?
      Mobile deposited funds are available on the day after the deposit credit date, unless a hold is applied. If a hold is required on the check, you’ll receive a message during the deposit, and you’ll be able to cancel the deposit. If you continue with the deposit, you can get information about the funds availability through Wells Fargo Mobile or Wells Fargo Online.
      For example, if you make a deposit before the cut-off time on a Monday funds are generally available on Tuesday. If you make a deposit after the cut-off time on a Friday, funds are typically available on the following Tuesday. Business days are Monday through Friday except holidays. The deposit credit date is provided on your Mobile Deposit confirmation screen and in the email we send you when your transaction is complete.
When will my mobile deposit be available?
      Funds are available on the next business day after the day of your deposit, unless a hold is applied. If a deposit is held (or a hold is applied), funds are posted to your account but are not immediately available to cover debits or withdrawals. Common reasons include:
Large deposit amount
Frequent overdrafts
Deposited check returned unpaid
Indications a deposited check may not be paid
If a hold will be applied to any portion of your deposit, you’ll receive a message on your mobile device, including when funds will be available, prior to submitting your deposit. You can cancel your deposit at this time. If you continue and submit your mobile deposit, you’ll receive information about the hold in the confirmation email sent to your primary email address and secure inbox.

You’ll know that your deposit is available when the amount appears in the available balance2 of the account you selected when you submitted your mobile deposit.
How do I select a default account for Mobile Deposit?
      To make an account the default for Mobile Deposit, select the account from the Select Account screen, check the Default account for mobile deposit box, and select Continue to proceed.
Note: If you have only one account eligible for Mobile Deposit, it will automatically be your default account.
Is there a limit on how much money I can deposit using the Wells Fargo Mobile app?
      Yes, your mobile deposit limits are shown for each eligible account within the Amount field when making a deposit.
What should I do with my paper check after using mobile deposit?
      After depositing your check using Mobile Deposit, please follow these best practice guidelines:
Write “Mobile deposit on Date” on the front of your check. The date should be the month, day, and year of your deposit.
Securely store your check for 5 days after your deposit, and then destroy it. This allows sufficient time in case the original check is required for any reason.
